thread.title: Why Wasn’t Monday’s Stock Plunge Far Worse?

author: James Mackintosh
title: Why Wasn’t Monday’s Stock Plunge Far Worse?
text:
The relationship between volatility and stock prices broke down spectacularly this week, and it is being taken as good news for investors.
There is a strong historical link between the S&P 500 and the Cboe Volatility Index, or Vix. When the Vix goes up, shares go down, by about one-quarter as much. Luckily for shareholders, on Monday that link snapped. Had the S&P fallen in line with the long-term pattern, shares would have plunged around 27% on Monday when the Vix more than doubled in a day for the first time.
